helm-values.affinity.description:
A Kubernetes Affinity, if required.
For more information, see [Assigning Pods to Nodes](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node).

For example:
affinity:
  nodeAffinity:
   requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
     nodeSelectorTerms:
     - matchExpressions:
       - key: foo.bar.com/role
         operator: In
         values:
         - master

helm-values.enable.description: This field can be used as a condition when using it as a dependency. This definition is only here as a placeholder such that it is included in the json schema.

helm-values.fullnameOverride.description: Override the "job-manager-syncer.fullname" value. This value is used as part of most of the names of the resources created by this Helm chart.

helm-values.jobManagerServerSyncerServic.description: The address of the job-manager-server to call syncer services.

helm-values.kubernetesManager.enableLead.description: Specify whether to enable the leader election.

helm-values.kubernetesManager.healthBind.description: The bind address for the health probe serving.

helm-values.kubernetesManager.metricsBin.description: The bind address for the metrics serving.

helm-values.kubernetesManager.pprofBindA.description: The bind address for the pprof serving.

helm-values.livenessProbe.enabled.description: Specify whether to enable the liveness probe.

helm-values.livenessProbe.failureThresho.description: After a probe fails `failureThreshold` times in a row, Kubernetes considers that the overall check has failed: the container is not ready/healthy/live.

helm-values.livenessProbe.initialDelaySe.description: Number of seconds after the container has started before startup, liveness or readiness probes are initiated.

helm-values.livenessProbe.periodSeconds.description: How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds.

helm-values.livenessProbe.successThresho.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed.

helm-values.livenessProbe.timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out.

helm-values.logLevel.description: The log level of the inference-manager-engine container.

helm-values.nameOverride.description: Override the "job-manager-syncer.name" value, which is used to annotate some of the resources that are created by this Chart (using "app.kubernetes.io/name").

helm-values.nodeSelector.description: The nodeSelector on Pods tells Kubernetes to schedule Pods on the nodes with matching labels. For more information, see [Assigning Pods to Nodes](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/).

helm-values.podAnnotations.description: Optional additional annotations to add to the Deployment Pods.

helm-values.podSecurityContext.description:
Security Context for the job-manager-syncer pod.
For more information, see [Configure a Security Context for a Pod or Container](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/).

helm-values.replicaCount.description: The number of replicas for the job-manager-syncer Deployment.

helm-values.resources.description:
Resources to provide to the job-manager-syncer pod. For more information, see [Resource Management for Pods and Containers](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-Containers/).

For example:
requests:
  cpu: 10m
  memory: 32Mi

helm-values.securityContext.description: Security Context for the job-manager-syncer container. For more information, see [Configure a Security Context for a Pod or Container](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/).

helm-values.serviceAccount.create.description: Specifies whether a service account should be created.

helm-values.serviceAccount.name.description: The name of the service account to use. If not set and create is true, a name is generated using the fullname template.

helm-values.tenant.apiKeySecret.key.description: The key name with a api key set.

helm-values.tenant.tls.enable.description: The flag to enable TLS access to the control-plane.

helm-values.tolerations.description:
A list of Kubernetes Tolerations, if required.
For more information, see [Taints and Tolerations](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/).

For example:
tolerations:
- key: foo.bar.com/role
  operator: Equal
  value: master
  effect: NoSchedule

helm-values.version.description: Override the container image tag to deploy by setting this variable. If no value is set, the chart's appVersion will be used.

helm-values.volumeMounts.description: Additional volume mounts to add to the job-manager-syncer container. For more information, see [Volumes](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/).

helm-values.volumes.description: Additional volumes to add to the job-manager-syncer pod. For more information, see [Volumes](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/).
